definition: to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance
to fear
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳进河里了，但小内德畏缩不前。

sentences.english: German banks are balking at writing off Greek debt.
sentences.chinese: 德国各家银行在勾销希腊债务方面畏缩不前。

sentences.english: The dog cringed at the sight of the whip.
Did we brave all then to falter now?
sentences.chinese: 当时我们英勇奋斗，今天却要畏缩不前吗？

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river, but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩都跳下河了，但小内德畏缩不前。

sentences.english: Have you ever held back on doing something because you were afraid of failure?
sentences.chinese: 你是否曾因为害怕失败而畏缩不前？

sentences.english: Thou wilt not cower in the dust.
sentences.chinese: 你不会含屈忍辱畏缩不前。

sentences.english: He said he could swim, but he backed down when we got to the lake.
sentences.chinese: 他说他会泅水，但是等咱们到了湖边他却畏缩不前了。

sentences.english: The dog cringed at the sight of a snake.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗看见了一条蛇便畏缩不前。

sentences.english: The coward quai- led before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这个懦夫在敌人面前畏缩不前。

sentences.english: He always funked when competition grew too keen.
sentences.chinese: 在竞争太激烈时他总是畏缩不前。

sentences.english: He cowered when he saw all of the TV cameras.
sentences.chinese: 看到了四周的电视摄像机，他有些畏缩不前。

sentences.english: Follow your heart. It's wiser than you think. And for God's sake don't be scared.
sentences.chinese: 跟随着心的方向，不要畏缩不前，这才是明智的做法。

sentences.english: We can't afford to have anyone in this enterprise who is likely to turn yellow when the testing-time comes.
sentences.chinese: 我们的企业不能雇用在考验关头可能畏缩不前的人。

sentences.english: The coward quailed before the enemy.
sentences.chinese: 这个懦夫在敌人面前畏缩不前。

definition: afraid of the head, terrified of the tail (idiom); ever fearful and nervous/afraid of the slightest thing
to stand still without advancing (idiom); to hesitate and hold back
to hesitate to move forward/to hesitate/to hold back
to shrink back as the time for battle approaches (idiom)/to get cold feet
hesitant to take action
timidity/timid/cowardly
lit. to fear the wolf in front and the tiger behind (idiom)/fig. to be full of needless fears/reds under the beds
pinyin: qian2 pa4 lang2 hou4 pa4 hu3

definition: to hesitate to move forward/to balk/to jib
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to sit and waste a good opportunity (idiom); to lose the chance
timid/gutless/weakling
to shrink back/to cower
downhearted/downcast/in despair
chicken-hearted (idiom)/gutless
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); at a loss/in a hopeless situation
